The presence of multifocal neurological lesions (cranial nerve, spinal cord, cerebellum) combined with systemic symptoms (chronic cough, palpitations) strongly suggests a systemic granulomatous or inflammatory condition. Neurosarcoidosis is the leading differential, linking the pulmonary, cardiac, and multifocal CNS findings. Other key considerations include demyelination, chronic infection, or malignancy.
